Instruction: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, and salt. In a separate bowl, combine sugar, eggs, and vanilla; mix well. Gradually add the sugar mixture to the flour mixture, stirring until just combined. Fold in melted butter until the batter is smooth.

In a large bowl, beat the egg whites and sugar with an electric mixer until stiff peaks form. In a separate bowl, combine the vinegar, vanilla, and cornstarch until smooth. Gradually add the cornstarch mixture to the egg white mixture and continue to beat until thick and glossy, about 4 minutes.
Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour, until the outside is dry and lightly golden. Turn off the oven and let the pavlova cool in the oven with the door closed for 1 hour.
In a large bowl, combine quinoa, water, lemon juice, coriander, and onion. Season with salt and pepper; stir well. Let sit for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
